channel.title: Reflections on Hareesh Kanchanepally
channel.description: Recent content in Reflections on Hareesh Kanchanepally

item.title: S2E03 #WeekNotes 15-21 Jan '24
item.description:
Living Intently: Reflection, Thought, Choice #

Key Themes this week: #

This week, the juggle became real. Work and life intertwined, both echoing themes of attention, care, and intention. Yet, a subtle shift felt like sand slipping through my fingers – the descent from conscious action to reactive busyness.

Work meetings consumed mental resources, making my daily journal an uphill battle. Yet, the irony – amidst that struggle, I became a prolific work-related writer! I engaged with professional content, captured thoughts on product delivery must-haves, and penned a passionate defence of dates and estimates as valuable tools, not shackles. Perhaps the key lies in understanding those “must-do"s. Are they internal expectations, the siren call of proving my worth, or external demands I readily embrace? Next week, I aim to untangle their source and prioritize with greater intention.

item.title: S2E02 #WeekNotes 8-14 Jan '24
item.description:
Key Themes for the week #

  • Common to both professional and personal lives

    • Keep checking on the Values helps to be more intentional.

    • Presence - carried forward from the above, the day-to-day is already starting to distract and the presence - I hate to admit, took a bit of a brunt.

    • Other emergent theme in the work front is: Managing PgMs and setting out a clear set of expectations: Absolute Must for PgM

item.title: S01E50: #weeknotes: 11-17 December, 2023
item.description:
As we bid farewell to 2023, it’s time to reflect and look ahead, while keeping up the momentum. While it’s been a busy year, I’m looking forward to the Christmas break.

Key Themes for the week, 11-17 Dec 2023 #

Budget Approvals for 2024:

The annual budget approval cycle presents an interesting challenge: aligning traditional cost accounting based on projects with the need for value streams and cross-team collaboration. We’ve developed plans based on the approved envelope and presented them to the Governance forums for approval. We’ll have to provide further details on the value generated from previous funding.

item.title: S01E03: #weeknotes: 16-20 January
item.description:
A Smooth Transition into 2023: Quarterly Planning, Insights, and Dune

The year 2022 concluded with the same energy and flavor as its preceding months, but 2023 carries an undercurrent of solidity and assurance. As we navigate the early weeks of this new year, several key themes have emerged, shaping my focus and approach.

Quarterly Planning: Inceptions and Construction Beginnings

The beginning is always delicate. As we embark on this quarter’s planning, Dune’s profound quote resonates deeply: “Beginnings are delicate. They must be nurtured like small flames.” We must carefully consider our goals, strategies, and resource allocation, ensuring that every initiative ignites with the potential to flourish.

item.title: S01E02: #weeknotes: 9-13 January
item.description:
Though the year 23 started off with same fervour and flavour experience end of 22, there’s some solidity and assuredness to this year. There were numerous posts on the Weeks

Key themes of focus this week (9 -13 Jan, 23) #

  • Performance review: What’s the year 22 was like and what I can take from it into 23.

  • Quarterly planning.

  • Feature vs Component teams.

  • New Portfolio ownership.

Key insights, feelings, and actions from this week (09 - 13 Jan, 23) #

  • Probably, Just, Maybe, and Perhaps. - Conversation with Chris/Richard re. MSC/Phase 4 combination.
